intro: Dicliptera fasciata, commonly known as the zebra grass, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, striped leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats and has a fibrous root system. Its flowering stems produce small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, white to pale green flowers. Dicliptera fasciata is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
